item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (65 points | 6 comments)
2. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they're made (24 points | 6 comments)
3. Donald Bitzer has died (34 points | 3 comments)
4. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (9 points | 1 comment)
5. Three Mistakes from Dart/Flutter's Weak PRNG (36 points | 25 comments)

7. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (255 points | 62 comments)

9. Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder (574 points | 284 comments)
10. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (203 points | 28 comments)

13. Librebooting the ThinkPad T480 (112 points | 47 comments)
14. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (1014 points | 152 comments)

18. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (343 points | 165 comments)

20. C++ exception performance three years later (70 points | 44 comments)
21. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (1028 points | 422 comments)
22. Unexpected Keyboard (232 points | 119 comments)
23. Saving Voyager 1 [video] (51 points | 6 comments)
24. The age of average (2023) (188 points | 121 comments)
25. The secret life of DNS packets (2019) (80 points | 12 comments)
26. "Rules" that terminal programs follow (209 points | 111 comments)
27. Parkinson's Law: It’s real, so use it (213 points | 151 comments)
28. Show HN: Lfi – a lazy functional sync, async, and concurrent iteration library (85 points | 35 comments)
29. Bitbanging 1D Reversible Automata (93 points | 22 comments)
30. Scrabble star wins Spanish world title despite not speaking Spanish (115 points | 100 comments)
